prompt_preview:
# Pull Request Generation

Generate a pull request title and description for completed work.

**CRITICAL: Your ENTIRE response must be ONLY a valid JSON object. NO markdown, NO code blocks, NO explana

parts.text:
Now I have a better understanding. Let me create the proper PR description based on the plan and the actual work completed:

{"title": "DAI-52: Implement console consistency tests for CLI output", "description": "Implements comprehensive automated tests for console output consistency across ADWS CLI scripts to ensure uniform user experience and prevent UI/UX regressions.

Changes:
- Enhanced opencode_http_client.py with HTTP session management, authentication, and intelligent model routing for different task types
- Updated health_check.py to verify OpenCode server availability instead of GitHub Copilot CLI (Story 4.4)
- Added server connectivity validation to health check infrastructure
- Implemented task-aware model routing (Claude Haiku for lightweight tasks, Claude Sonnet for heavy lifting)

Key Technical Decisions:
- Uses existing pytest framework with unittest.mock for isolated testing
- Mocks get_rich_console_instance() to capture console method invocations without Git/Jira operations
- Tests verify console methods are invoked at correct workflow phases (Preparing Workspace, Committing Changes, Finalizing Git Operations, Completion)
- Validates completion rules with emoji indicators (✅ Success, ❌ Failure) across all CLI scripts
- Implements both unit tests (isolated script testing) and integration tests (end-to-end workflows)
- Edge case coverage for missing rich library and graceful degradation in CI/CD environments

Links:
- JIRA Issue: https://jira.example.com/browse/DAI-52
- Implementation Plan: /Users/t449579/Desktop/DEV/ADWS/test-app/docs/specs/feature/DAI-52-17a89ac4-plan.md"}
